captions.text: But now it's time for the baddest wolf of all:
the pack leader behind door No. 3.
A BMW M6.
The body isn't exactly sheep's clothes, but nobody would ever guess
what lurks under the hood of this specimen.
Car tuning studio G-Power in Aresing is responsible for small modifications.
Under the hood is a V10 bi-compressor with 788 hp.
That incredible power hurls the beast from 0 to 60 in 4.2 seconds.
It's maximum speed is an unbelievable 214 mph.
Fuel consumption? Over 12 mpg of Super Plus.
For that kind of performance the price is a steal:
But that'll buy you a roaring jack hammer,
complete with an autograph from the boss.
So, here we go.
Holy shit!
This M6 is not for the faint of heart. It's an alpha leader
with a passion for smoke signals.
If you're not satisfied with the gear ratio
you can order the world record gear box.
Then the Bavarian can go over 230 mph.
Damn! This is one sick ride!
The engine modifications are sick too:
they cost 56,000 euro.
But it's pure adrenaline and skidding pleasure, guaranteed.
It's like the car can't keep up.

It twists the whole time.
The rear wheels keep spinning.

You have to compensate
with the front wheels.

We have to talk a look
at these crazy skid marks.

They're the longest skid marks
I've ever made.

They start here.
We came from there, in second gear.
Then they start here.
They stop here after about 330 feet,

where I changed
from second to third gear.

And then the two black skid marks
keep going in third gear.

Till way back there.
Let's jog over.

We have to exercise too,
not just the cars.

Back here it swerved sideways,
in third gear, mind you!

I'm not shitting you,
this is no joke...
The skid marks are still going!
All the way till... just a second...
So, they're still going.
Here's the end of the skid marks.
Hello? Can you still see me?

You have to let it soak in.
Look at this view.

Those are skid marks
a third of a mile long.
And that's supposed to be understated?

To call the body of the BMW M6
sheep's clothing
it total nonsense.

But this one doesn't have 500 hp,
like the original.
It's got  788 hp.
And that's sheep's clothing,

because nobody
would expect this car to have 800.
Until they see the skid marks.
Now Matthias is going to test out his theory
in the wild.
An 788 hp machine like this

can't reach its full potential
on a little track.

You need
the German autobahn for that.
We're going about 125 mph.

That's a walk in the park
for the M6 from G-Power.
It's like going 60 in any other car.
The tuned BMW is adjusted for comfort
and can get you where you want to go, stress-free.
So, let's go from 60 to 185 mph.
That goes insanely fast.

We were just in third gear,
and when we hit 110 mph

the little traction light went on.
I like that.
155 mph, next gear...
There's no way it can go that fast.

They must've
rigged the speedometer.
No, Matthias, they didn't.
The sturdy Bavarian
goes from 0 to 185 mph in just 26 seconds.
What looks like a video game
is the impressive reality created by G-Power.
Now we just need somebody to challenge this monster.

What have we here?
A Porsche!
How nice!
But it's not just any Porsche.
It's a GT3.

The fat rear wing...
It's a GT3 RS.

But that's only
half the horsepower of this baby.
So, you gonna flash me or what?
Turns out the Porsche driver wants bragging rights.
I'm happy to get out of the way.
Chop-chop. Bye!
So, the Porsche...

... is getting pretty tiny,
pretty quickly back there.

Doesn't stand a chance.
Incredible!

If you've ever been in a GT3,
and you know what it's capable of,

then you know
what kind of punishing he just took.
Let's see if they're crying.
Bye.

Come on,
let's pass them again, eh?
It's a no-brainer for Matthias:

The fiercest wolf in sheep's clothing
can only be the M6.

The others are really cool,
and of course much more affordable.

The MPS with 256 hp
packs quite a punch,
so does the OPC of course,

but this superpower with 788 hp,
is absolute killer.
Only an empty gas tank could stop Matthias today.
Too bad that goes way too quickly.

comments.author: Wolfgang Kaminski

comments.text:
Still at 4.2 seconds with Launch Control? Lol, still no match for the 
Godzilla (Nissan GT-R), we saw that with the M6 ASR of 750 bhp. However, 
this M6 will probably eat most cars at higher speeds on the Autobahn or 
airfield drag strips. :)﻿
comments.author: Dreamon - The Belgian Critic

comments.text:
True, it gives the best it can from both worlds. But you'd never see me 
drive in an M6, because i like cars lightweight, agile and fast. Although i 
did consider to by an E46 M3, that car was just fun as hell when i drove it 
with a friend, but then again it didn't have enough grip and road stability 
for me and buying new tires for every 10 times you pull up or take a corner 
fast is just a bit too much for me :P
comments.author: Dreamon - The Belgian Critic

comments.text:
Thats all perfectly correct, but what I try to say is that the M6 combines 
Power, Racetrack abilities, luxury, space and the ability to go comfortly 
and fast on the Autobahn in one car (and not in 3 or 4). It does nothing 
perfectly, but at least quite good i think.
comments.author: Lukas Merk

comments.text:
Yeah, but this isn't a standard M6 and drifting is fun yes, but if i want 
fun drifting, then i'd use an M3, a Mazda RX-7, Honda NSX or whatever... 
And i do believe that very heavy weighted luxury cars can never give the 
thrills of a smaller car. For example: you won't even notice/feel that 
you're doing 160kph in a 6 series because of the comfort suspensions and 
weight, compared to a Mégane RS Trophy R which has the record for FWD cars 
and has been voted the most fun Hot Hatchback you'll ever own, even after 
the regular Mégane RS was voted on Top Gear and Fifth Gear as the best Hot 
Hatchback since 2008 untill 2013.
comments.author: Dreamon - The Belgian Critic

comments.text:
+Dreamon - The Belgian Critic you're right, but (to put it better) its the 
bmw 6 series model with the most driving fun. And I dont think that you 
want to have a faster car when you're sitting in a m6 (or do you own a gt-r 
or whatever?). I also think that drifting and not having traction can be 
real fun, as Matthias shows in the video too.
comments.author: Lukas Merk

comments.text:
You are right that the comparison of the M6 and GT-R isn't right, because 
they're different classes of cars. BUT i really disagree with "driving 
fun"... the lighter and more nimble a car is, the more you will feel all 
the corners and G-forces, but the bigger and more luxurious it gets the 
more boring and  less "fun" it will feel. For example: on a race track the 
GT-R will give you a maximum adrenaline rush (which is defined as driving 
fun), the M6 on a race track will more likely spin out of control in 
corners because of the RWD.    I think you meant the M6 has a better 
driving comfort.
comments.author: Dreamon - The Belgian Critic

comments.text:
+Dreamon - The Belgian Critic ok you didnt understand me. I wanted to say 
that maybe the m6 gtr would match the nissan gtr. And I know the nissan gtr 
is a street car. 
BUT I think the m6 is still a good car. 1st, its rwd, so for acceleration 
it can never match an equally powered awd. 2nd, the m6 hasnt the aim to be 
the fastest, it wants to be a elegant and sporty luxury coupé with maximum 
driving fun. It isnt a race car as the gtr. 3rd, it has its qualitys on 
other sides. As its a m6, it has luxury and a very good infotainment. It 
has much space, is good for all day use and also not bad on the track. It 
can be silent and loud, hard or more comfortable. And (to me) it also looks 
better, but hasnt to be your opinion ;)
comments.author: Lukas Merk

comments.text:
The Nissan GT-R is a street version m8. It's not a racetrack version like 
an M3 GTR. The GT-R is just a Skyline, only a different name. The Nissan 
GT-R is also a 4-seat car of 540hp (the M6 has 575hp now). The reason why 
they compare them is because BMW fans can't handle the fact that a Japanese 
street legal 4-seat GT car beats all their 4-seat GT cars (M5 and M6).
comments.author: Dreamon - The Belgian Critic

comments.text:
+Dreamon - The Belgian Critic why? So senseless! Its literally a luxury 
coupé with sports car features. Maybe the m6 gtr would be a competitor, but 
not the street version.
comments.author: Lukas Merk

comments.text:
+Lukas Merk
yet BMW fans are constantly comparing the M6 as the car that can beat the 
GT-R
comments.author: Dreamon - The Belgian Critic
